title: Comparative Simulation-Based Training for Springboard Diving Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic diving theory and human biomechanics
context.additional_context: Professionals in medical/legal/technical fields acquiring methods to apply principles of motion dynamics through simulation-based learning in language domains

learning_goals: Learners can explain kinematic differences in springboard diving preparation movements between land and underwater training environments.
Learners can analyze and compare differences in board operations (step length, jump height, board angle) between the two environments through VR simulations.
Learners can evaluate how the same joint coordination patterns are applied across diverse training environments through case studies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
